meanings.definition: Not severe or harsh in nature
meanings.sent1: The sun felt milder today, not as hot as yesterday.
meanings.sent2: The winter this year is milder compared to last year.
meanings.sent3: The milder breeze made the kite fly gently in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her milder tone of voice soothed the upset child instantly.
meanings.sent5: The milder scent of the flowers filled the room with a delicate fragrance.

meanings.definition: Less intense or extreme than something else
meanings.sent1: The coffee tasted milder with a hint of sweetness.
meanings.sent2: The storm grew milder as it moved away from the coast.
meanings.sent3: His milder reaction surprised everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The milder version of the movie was more suitable for children.
meanings.sent5: The milder flavor of the dish allowed the spices to shine through subtly.
